io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control

Class Joystick

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.control.Joystick

  • public class Joystick
extends java.lang.Object
    A Joystick object represents one of the physical game controllers that are connected to the driver station.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

      private com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad baseGamepad

    • Field Detail

      • baseGamepad

        private com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad baseGamepad
        The Gamepad that this object should recieve information from.
        See Also:
        Gamepad

      • JOYSTICK_THRESHOLD

        public static final double JOYSTICK_THRESHOLD
        The threshold that must be exceeded by the raw thumb stick values before it should register at all. The purpose of this value is to prevent random joystick noise and false movements from being registered and acted upon.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JOYSTICK_MAX

        public static final double JOYSTICK_MAX
        The maximum value that can be expected from the thumb stick values.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JOYSTICK_REST

        public static final double JOYSTICK_REST
        The value that should be expected from the thumb sticks when the thumb stick is at rest.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JOYSTICK_MIN

        public static final double JOYSTICK_MIN
        The minimum value that can be expected from the thumb stick values.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRIGGER_MAX

        public static final double TRIGGER_MAX
        The maximum value that can be expected from the trigger values.
        See Also:

      • Joystick

    • Method Detail

      • scaleJoystickInput

        private static double scaleJoystickInput(double raw)
        Scales the given input value to a number between the rest position and the maximum position of the thumb stick, based on its relative position between the minimum and maximum positions. This allows the thumb sticks to show a smooth transition between the minimum and the maximum, even though any value less than the threshold will be reported as zero.
        Parameters:
        raw - the raw input value from the joystick, between the threshhold and maximum positions.
        Returns:
        the corresponding value between the minimum and maximum positions.
